results.title: The Kimberley: land of the Wandjina [DVD] (A)
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), ABC-TV (Australia). Natural History Unit and Jeremy Hogarth
results.brief_description: Narrated by Leo McKern, this documentary, produced by the award-winning ABC TV Natural History Unit, explores the land and life of the spectacular Kimberley region of North West Australia. Aboriginal people believe that the Wandjina, the rain spirits, created the landscape. From the vast coastal mudflats to the tidal rivers and inland waterways, this beautifully photographed film explores in detail one of the least known regions of Australia.

results.title: The Kimberley mob (A)
results.creator_credit: Film Four International, ABC-TV (Australia), Graeme Isaac and Graham Chase
results.brief_description: 1n 1967 Aborigines, were finally given equal rights and pay, but paradoxically this has meant that many Aboriginal stockmen are now considerably worse off. This film documents the struggles of the Watson brothers and their sons to reclaim the abandoned Mount Anderson Station in the Kimberleys for the Looma Community. Not only do they have to deal with threats to their land from mining companies, but they also struggle against the lack of support from their own community whose culture is under threat from the evangelical Assembly of God and alcohol.

results.title: The Killing times (A)
results.brief_description: In August 1928, in the desert of Central Australia, seven white Australians murdered seventeen members of the Walbiri tribe. The Coniston Massacre, as it became known, was the last large-scale massacre of Aborigines in Australia. This video dramatises the massacre and the subsequent Federal Inquiry, as well as the eventual victory of the Walbiri for the right to return and live where they were born. The cast includes Ray Barrett, Max Gillies and Martin Vaughan. Narrated by Bob Plasto. Teacher’s notes accompany the video.

results.title: The Killing of Sister George [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Palomar Pictures, Associates and Aldrich Company and Robert Aldrich
results.brief_description: The erosion of a longtime lesbian affair between a television star (Beryl Reid) who plays the role of “Sister George” the bleeding heart heroine on a British TV soap opera and her younger lover (Susannah York). The breakup of the relationship comes about when a broadcast executive who fancies the younger woman, decides to write Reid out of her key TV role. The basic thrust of the plot is the gradual development of a rapport and sympathy with Reid, in inverse ratio to the loss of respect for York. The film received an X rating on its release due to a controversial five-minute lesbian love scene. Director Robert Aldrich achieved the look and feel of a “Made in Britain” picture, although most of it was shot near downtown LA. Cast also includes Carol Browne, Ronald Fraser, Patricia Medina and Hugh Paddick. Screenplay by Lukas Heller from the play by Frank Marcus.

results.title: The Killing of Angelo Tsakos
results.brief_description: In 1985, Angelo Tsakos, a young Greek-Australian boy from the depressed western suburbs of Sydney was shot dead while driving a stolen car, by a probationary police constable. He was only sixteen. At the inquiry into the incident, three differing versions of the event were described. This film reconstructs these versions and finds questions still unanswered. His family continue in their efforts to get a full enquiry into the killing of Angelo Tsakos.

results.title: The Killing of Angel Street
results.brief_description: Jessica Simmonds returns home from London and is shocked to find the street she grew up in being torn apart to make way for a high rise development. She sympathises with the plight of the local residents, who are being forced out of their homes by the brutal tactics of the developers. Probing into the background of Angel street development, she unearths a sinister connection between organised crime, the developer, the police and the highest levels of government.

results.title: The Killing of a Chinese bookie
results.creator_credit: Faces Distribution Corporation, Al Ruban and John Cassavetes
results.brief_description: The Killing of a Chinese Bookie presents a portrait of a man who is so self-sufficient that he cannot become personally involved with anyone. Cosmo Vitelli, played by Ben Gazzara, is a nightclub owner who believes in conducting his personal and business affairs with plenty of flair and professionalism. When the mob threatens him he works desperately to save his face and the club.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Faces Distribution Corporation, Al Ruban and John Cassavetes

results.title: The Killing fields
results.brief_description: David Puttnam brings to the screen an intense and personal story of loyalty, friendship and survival amidst the torment of war and the incredible strength of one man’s will to survive. Based on Pulitzer prize winning correspondent, Sydney Schanberg’s 1980 article “The Death and Life of Dith Pran”, this gripping movie is a factual account of Schanberg’s friendship and professional relationship with his trusted interpreter, trouble-shooter and colleague - Pran - during the turbulent period that saw Cambodia fall to the Khmer Rouge. Stars Sam Waterston and Haing S. Ngor. Film soundtrack music score by Mike Oldfield.

results.title: The Killing
results.creator_credit: Harris-Kubrick Pictures Corporation, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, James B. Harris and Stanley Kubrick
results.brief_description: A race-track robbery is planned with clockwork precision but Kubrick dispassionately observes how the mechanism is ruined by human fallibility. The intricate flashback structure presents a plot of chess-like moves in a hard boiled, visually stylised underworld richly populated by film noir stereotypes. Based on the novel “Clean Break” by Lionel White. Cast includes Sterling Hayden, Coleen Gray, Vince Edwards and Jay C Flippen.
